content.question: Let f be the function defined by f(x) = 2xe−x for all real numbers x. (a) Write an equation of the horizontal asymptote for the graph of f.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function defined by f(x) = 2xe−x for all real numbers x. (a) Write an equation of the horizontal asymptote for the graph of f.
(b) Find the x-coordinate of each critical point of f. For each such x, determine whether f(x) is a relative maximum, a relative minimum, or neither.
(c) For what values of x is the graph of f concave down?
(d) Using the results found in parts (a), (b), and (c), sketch the graph of y = f(x) in the xy-plane provided below.

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
